medical_history.chief_complaint: 24 hours of abdominal pain located in the right lower quadrant.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The abdominal pain began 24 hours prior to presentation and is described as constant and sharp, with no radiation. The patient had an episode of upper abdominal pain a few days ago that resolved on its own. Additionally, she has experienced chills but no fevers, mild nausea without emesis, and loss of appetite.
medical_history.family_history: Mother with a history of colon cancer; no history of inflammatory bowel disease (IBD).
